io.sphere.client.shop.model

Class VariantList

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.client.shop.model.VariantList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Variant>

    public class VariantList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Variant>
    List of variants of a Product that supports filtering by various criteria.

      • byAttributes

        @Nonnull
public VariantList byAttributes(Attribute desiredAttribute,
                               Attribute... desiredAttributes)
        Finds variants that have all given attribute values.

        Example:

        Implement a variant switcher for colors of current product:

        for (Attribute color: product.getVariants().getAvailableAttributes("color")) { Variant variant = p.getVariants().byAttributes(color).first().get(); // use get() only if you are sure the variant exists }

        Implement a variant switcher that changes color, maintaining selected size:

        VariantList greenVariants = p.getVariants().byAttributes(new Attribute("color", "green")); VariantList greenInCurrentSize = greenVariants.byAttributes(currentVariant.getAttribute("size"));

        Parameters:
        desiredAttribute - Attribute that the returned variants must have.
        desiredAttributes - Additional attributes that the returned variants must have.
        Returns:
        Variants that have all given attribute values.

      • byAttributes

        @Nonnull
public VariantList byAttributes(@Nonnull
                               java.lang.Iterable<Attribute> desiredAttributes)
        Finds variants that have all given attribute values.

        Example:

        Implement a variant switcher for colors of current product:

        for (Attribute color: product.getVariants().getAvailableAttributes("color")) { Variant variant = p.getVariants().byAttributes(color).first().get(); // use get() only if you are sure the variant exists }

        Implement a variant switcher that changes color, maintaining selected size:

        VariantList greenVariants = p.getVariants().byAttributes(new Attribute("color", "green")); VariantList greenInCurrentSize = greenVariants.byAttributes(currentVariant.getAttribute("size"));

        Parameters:
        desiredAttributes - Attributes that the returned variants must have.
        Returns:
        Variants that have all given attribute values.
